intro: Bravaisia berlandieriana, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has hairy, ribbed stems and heart-shaped leaves that are adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Bravaisia berlandieriana is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
